docs.name: ntile
docs.full: Divides the vector into n buckets.

docs.name: unknown
docs.full: A placeholder function that returns a greeting.

docs.name: cor
docs.full: Computes the Pearson correlation coefficient between two vectors.

params.name: na_rm
params.description: (Optional) Should missing values be removed? Default is false.

docs.name: shape
docs.full: Returns the shape of an NDArray as a list of integers.

docs.name: index_of
docs.full: Returns the index of the first occurrence of `sub` in `s`, or -1 if not found.

return.description: The index of the first occurrence.

docs.name: to_lower
docs.full: Converts all characters in the string to lowercase.

docs.name: sum
docs.full: Calculates the sum of values in a List or Vector.

params.name: na_rm
params.description: = false Remove NA values before summing.

docs.name: fit_stats
docs.full: Returns a one-row DataFrame containing model-level statistics (R-squared, AIC, etc.).

docs.name: pipeline_deps
docs.full: Returns a dictionary mapping node names to their dependencies.

docs.name: transpose
docs.full: Returns the transpose of a 2D NDArray.

docs.name: colnames
docs.full: Returns a list of column names in the DataFrame.

docs.name: na_float
docs.full: Represents a missing float value.

docs.name: casewhen
docs.full: Evaluates a series of `condition ~ value` formulas sequentially. Returns the value corresponding to the first true condition for each element.

params.description: One or more formulas of the form `condition ~ value`.

params.name: .default
params.description: (Optional) Value to return if no condition matches. Defaults to NA.

return.description: A vector of the matched values.

docs.name: explain
docs.full: Returns a dictionary describing the structure and content of a value.

return.description: A structured description of the value.

docs.name: replace
docs.full: Replaces all occurrences of `old` with `new_` in `s`.

docs.name: length
docs.full: Returns the number of elements in a collection (List, Vector, Dict). This function is NOT vectorized - it always returns the count of elements. For getting the number of characters in a string, use nchar() instead.

params.name: x
params.description: | Vector | Dict The collection to measure.

docs.name: dense_rank
docs.full: Assigns ranks to unique values, with no gaps.

docs.name: is_error
docs.brief: Check if a value is an Error
docs.full: Returns true if the value is an Error object, false otherwise.

return.description: True if x is an Error.

docs.name: explain_json
docs.full: Returns a JSON string representation of the explain output.

docs.name: intent_get
docs.full: Retrieves a field from an Intent object.

docs.name: quantile
docs.full: Computes the quantile of a distribution at a specified probability.

params.name: na_rm
params.description: (Optional) Should missing values be removed? Default is false.

docs.name: abs
docs.full: Returns the absolute value of a number or vector/ndarray elements.

docs.name: replace_first
docs.full: Replaces only the first occurrence of `old` with `new_` in `s`.

docs.name: cumany
docs.full: Calculates the cumulative logical OR of a vector.

docs.name: char_at
docs.full: Returns a single-character string at the specified index.

docs.name: cummax
docs.full: Calculates the cumulative maximum of a vector.

docs.name: arrange
docs.full: Sorts a DataFrame by a column. Use "desc" for descending order.

docs.name: help
docs.full: Prints the help documentation for the specified function, including signature, parameters, return value, and examples.

params.name: name
params.description: | Symbol The name of the function to document.

docs.name: filter
docs.full: Retains rows that satisfy the predicate function.

params.name: predicate
params.description: A function returning Bool for each row.

docs.name: select
docs.full: Selects specific columns from a DataFrame.

docs.name: assert
docs.full: Checks if a condition is true, raising an error if false.

docs.name: mutate
docs.full: Adds new columns or modifies existing ones.

params.description: New columns as name = expression pairs.

docs.name: to_array
docs.full: Converts numeric columns of a DataFrame to a matrix (NDArray).

params.name: cols
params.description: (Optional) Columns to include. Defaults to all numeric.

docs.name: lm
docs.full: Fits a linear regression model using Ordinary Least Squares (OLS).

params.name: formula
params.description: The model formula (e.g., mpg ~ wt + hp).

return.description: A model object containing coefficients, residuals, and statistics.

examples: model = lm(mpg ~ wt + hp, data: mtcars)

docs.name: join
docs.full: Concatenates items of a List or Vector into a single string, separated by `sep`.

docs.name: string
docs.full: Converts any value to its string representation.

docs.name: cumall
docs.full: Calculates the cumulative logical AND of a vector.

docs.name: cbind
docs.full: HELPER: Combines two matrices by columns.

docs.name: glimpse
docs.full: Prints a summary of the DataFrame structure, including dimensions, column names, types, and first few values.

docs.name: dataframe
docs.full: Constructs a DataFrame from a list of dictionaries (rows).

docs.name: cume_dist
docs.full: Calculates the cumulative distribution function (proportion of values <= current).

docs.name: sd
docs.full: Calculates the sample standard deviation of a numeric vector.

params.name: na_rm
params.description: (Optional) logical. Should missing values be removed? Default is false.

docs.name: lag
docs.full: Shifts a vector forward by n positions, filling with NA.

params.name: n
params.description: (Optional) Number of positions to shift. Default is 1.

docs.name: ndarray
docs.full: Creates a new NDArray from a list or vector of data, optionally specifying the shape. If shape is not provided, it is inferred from the nested structure of the input list.

params.name: data
params.description: | Vector The data to populate the array. Can be nested lists.

docs.name: na
docs.full: Represents a missing value of generic type.

docs.name: exp
docs.full: Calculates e raised to the power of x.

return.description: | Vector | NDArray The result of e^x.

docs.name: pretty_print
docs.full: Prints a formatted representation of a value. DataFrames are printed as tables.

docs.name: last_index_of
docs.full: Returns the index of the last occurrence of `sub` in `s`, or -1 if not found.

return.description: The index of the last occurrence.

docs.name: head
docs.full: Returns the first n items from a List, Vector, or DataFrame. For DataFrames, it returns the top n rows.

params.name: data
params.description: | List | Vector The collection to slice.

return.description: | List | Vector A subset of the input containing the first n items.

docs.name: get
docs.full: Retrieves an element from a List, Vector, or NDArray at the specified index (0-based).

params.name: collection
params.description: | Vector | NDArray The collection to access.

docs.name: na_string
docs.full: Represents a missing string value.

docs.name: kron
docs.full: Computes the Kronecker product of two matrices.

docs.name: pull
docs.full: Extracts a single column from a DataFrame as a Vector.

docs.name: pipeline_nodes
docs.full: Returns a list of node names in the pipeline.

docs.name: min
docs.full: Returns the minimum value in a vector or list.

docs.name: to_upper
docs.full: Converts all characters in the string to uppercase.

docs.name: contains
docs.full: Returns true if `sub` is present in `s`.

docs.name: apropos
docs.full: Searches all documented functions for names or descriptions matching the query.

docs.name: summarize
docs.full: Aggregates a DataFrame to a single row (or one row per group).

docs.name: lead
docs.full: Shifts a vector backward by n positions, filling with NA.

params.name: n
params.description: (Optional) Number of positions to shift. Default is 1.

docs.name: group_by
docs.full: Groups a DataFrame by one or more columns for subsequent aggregation.

docs.name: write_csv
docs.full: Writes a DataFrame to a CSV file.

docs.name: is_na
docs.full: Checks if a value is NA (Not Available).

return.description: True if the value is NA.

docs.name: nchar
docs.full: Returns the number of characters in a string. Vectorized.

docs.name: pow
docs.full: Calculates base raised to the power of exponent.

return.description: | Vector | NDArray The result of base ^ exponent.

docs.name: cummean
docs.full: Calculates the cumulative mean of a vector.

docs.name: slice
docs.full: Alias for `substring`. Returns the part of the string between `start` and `end` indices.

docs.name: ungroup
docs.full: Removes the grouping structure from a DataFrame.

docs.name: package_info
docs.full: Returns metadata for a specific package, including its description and functions.

docs.name: is_empty
docs.full: Returns true if the string has length 0.

docs.name: ndarray_data
docs.full: Returns the flattened data of an NDArray as a list of floats.

docs.name: map
docs.brief: Map a function over a list
docs.full: Applies a function to each element of a list and returns a new list of results.

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to apply to each element.

docs.name: reshape
docs.full: Returns a new NDArray with the same data but different dimensions. The total number of elements must remain the same.

return.description: A new array with the specified shape.

docs.name: sqrt
docs.full: Calculates the square root of x.

params.name: x
params.description: | Vector | NDArray The input value (must be non-negative).

docs.name: row_number
docs.full: Returns the rank of the current row, breaking ties by index.

docs.name: diag
docs.full: If input is 1D, creates a diagonal matrix. If input is 2D, extracts the diagonal elements.

docs.name: cumsum
docs.full: Calculates the cumulative sum of a vector.

docs.name: print
docs.full: Prints one or more values to stdout, separated by spaces, followed by a newline. Strings are printed without quotes.

docs.name: ncol
docs.full: Returns the number of columns in a DataFrame.

docs.name: nrow
docs.full: Returns the number of rows in a DataFrame or the length of a vector.

docs.name: percent_rank
docs.full: Calculates the proportional rank (0 to 1).

docs.name: read_csv
docs.full: Reads a CSV file into a DataFrame.

params.name: path
params.description: Path or URL to the CSV file.

params.name: skip_lines
params.description: (Optional) Number of lines to skip at start.

docs.name: ends_with
docs.brief: Check if string ends with suffix
docs.full: Returns true if `s` ends with the specified `suffix`.

return.description: True if s ends with suffix.

docs.name: starts_with
docs.brief: Check if string starts with prefix
docs.full: Returns true if `s` starts with the specified `prefix`.

return.description: True if s starts with prefix.

docs.name: mean
docs.brief: Compute arithmetic mean of numeric values
docs.full: The mean is the sum of values divided by the count. This function handles NA values explicitly through the na_rm parameter.

params.name: x
params.description: | List[Float] Input numeric data. Must contain at least one value.

params.name: na_rm
params.description: = false Remove NA values before computation.

return.description: | NA The arithmetic mean, or NA if input contains NA and na_rm is false

docs.name: max
docs.full: Returns the maximum value in a vector or list.

docs.name: type
docs.brief: Get the type name of a value
docs.full: Returns a string representation of the value's type (e.g., "Int", "String", "List").

docs.name: pipeline_run
docs.full: Re-executes a pipeline from start to finish.

docs.name: ifelse
docs.full: Vectorized conditional selection. Returns values from `true_val` or `false_val` depending on whether `condition` is true or false.

params.name: true_val
params.description: | Vector[Any] Value to return if condition is true.

params.name: false_val
params.description: | Vector[Any] Value to return if condition is false.

params.name: missing
params.description: (Optional) Value to return if condition is NA. Defaults to NA.

return.description: A vector of the same length as `condition`.

docs.name: packages
docs.full: Returns a list of all standard packages available in the environment.

docs.name: na_int
docs.full: Represents a missing integer value.

docs.name: pipeline_node
docs.full: Retrieves the value of a specific node in the pipeline.

docs.name: seq
docs.full: Creates a list of integers from start to end (inclusive).

docs.name: iota
docs.full: Creates a vector of length n filled with 1.0. Use with `seq` or `ndarray` for more complex interactions.

docs.name: matmul
docs.full: Performs matrix multiplication on two 2D NDArrays.

return.description: The product of the two matrices.

docs.name: intent_fields
docs.full: Returns all fields of an Intent object as a dictionary.

docs.name: log
docs.full: Calculates the natural logarithm (base e) of x.

params.name: x
params.description: | Vector | NDArray The input value (must be positive).

docs.name: substring
docs.full: Returns the part of the string between `start` and `end` indices.

docs.name: add_diagnostics
docs.full: augments the data with model diagnostic columns (residuals, fitted values, etc.).

params.name: data
params.description: (Optional) The data to augment. Defaults to model data.

return.description: The data with added diagnostic columns.

docs.name: summary
docs.full: Returns a tidy DataFrame of regression coefficients and statistics.

docs.name: error
docs.full: Raises a runtime error with a message and optional code.

docs.name: tail
docs.full: Returns the last n items from a List, Vector, or DataFrame. For DataFrames, it returns the bottom n rows.

params.name: data
params.description: | List | Vector The collection to slice.

return.description: | List | Vector A subset of the input containing the last n items.

docs.name: min_rank
docs.full: Assigns the minimum rank to ties, leaving gaps in ranks.

docs.name: cummin
docs.full: Calculates the cumulative minimum of a vector.

docs.name: inv
docs.full: Computes the multiplicative inverse of a square matrix.

docs.name: na_bool
docs.full: Represents a missing boolean value.
